events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car at an intersection, resulting in visible damages.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident based on the keywords and details provided by the claimant.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to handle the claim and provide further assistance to the customer.
The insurance company officially acknowledged the claim and confirmed receipt of the initial report from the customer.
Request sent for the customer's driving license, vehicle registration, police report, and photos of the accident damage.
Customer submitted all requested documents including accident photos, police report, and proof of insurance coverage.
Insurance adjuster initiated the investigation process to verify accident details and assess vehicle damage.
Investigation finalized with findings confirming the claim details and estimated repair costs for the damaged vehicle.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant based on the verified damages and applicable policy coverage.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement amount and expressed satisfaction with communication.
Claim was formally approved by the insurance company after agreement on the settlement terms with the customer.
The insurance payment covering the vehicle repairs was issued to the claimant's designated bank account.
The claim file was officially closed after all processes were completed and customer confirmed resolution.
All claim documentation and correspondence archived for future reference and compliance management.
